alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Berkshire, southeastern Washington, northern Rensselaer, southwestern Bennington and west central Windham Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 811 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cambridge to near West Sand Lake. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban or poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bennington, North Adams, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Stratton, Adams, Williamstown, Shaftsbury, Pownal, Cheshire, Grafton, Berlin, Cambridge, Stamford, New Ashford, West Sand Lake, Averill Park, Wynantskill, Brunswick and Sand Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
